143  template < class Tcontainer >
144  static Tcontainer CoverDomains(Tcontainer domains_, std::vector<int> attribs_allowed)
145  {
146  Tcontainer newDomains_;
147  for (std::vector<int>::const_iterator it=attribs_allowed.begin(); it != attribs_allowed.end(); ++it)
148  {
149  typename Tcontainer::iterator it_d=domains_.begin();
150  std::advance(it_d,*it);
151  newDomains_.push_back(*it_d);
152  //std::cout << *it_d << std::endl;
153  }
154  return newDomains_;
155  }
156  private:
158  friend class boost::serialization::access;
159 
160  template<class Archive>
161  void serialize( Archive &ar, const unsigned int /* file_version*/ ){
162  ar & boost::serialization::make_nvp("BaseTree",boost::serialization::base_object<DecisionTree<Val> >(*this));
163 
164  }
165 
166  };
167 
168  private:
170  friend class boost::serialization::access;

172  template<class Archive>
173  void serialize( Archive &ar, const unsigned int /* file_version*/ ){
174  ar.template register_type<RandomTree>();

176  ar & boost::serialization::make_nvp("RFCBase", boost::serialization::base_object<Classifier<Val> >(*this) );
177  ar & boost::serialization::make_nvp("RTrees", trees_ );
178  ar & boost::serialization::make_nvp("K", K_ );
179  }

211  template<typename Val>
212  void RandomForest<Val>::reset()
213  {
214  K_ = 0;
215  N_ = 0;
216  trees_.clear();
217  }
218 
219  template<typename Val>
220  void RandomForest<Val>::train(const ExamplesTrain& e)
221  {
222  int featuresNum_ = static_cast<int>(Classifier<Val>::getAttrDomains().size());
223 
224  // Breiman Forest-RI recommendation
225  K_ = K_ != 0 ? K_ : std::max(ceil(sqrt(2*e.size())) ,ceil(2*featuresNum_/ceil(sqrt(featuresNum_))) );
226  createForest();
227  for( typename RTrees::iterator it=trees_.begin(); it != trees_.end(); it++ )
228  {
229  RandomTree & obj = *(*it); // dereference iterator, dereference pointer
230  obj.train(exampleBootstrap(e));
231  //std::cout << obj << std::endl << std::endl;
232  }
233  }
234 
235  template<typename Val>
236  typename RandomForest<Val>::AttrIdd RandomForest<Val>::getCategory(const ExampleTest& e) const
237  {
238  //std::list< typename Val::Value> results_;
239  std::list< RandomForest<Val>::AttrIdd> results_;
240  for( typename RTrees::const_iterator it=trees_.begin(); it != trees_.end(); it++ )
241  {
242  RandomTree & obj = *(*it); // dereference iterator, dereference pointer
243  results_.push_back(obj.getCategory(e));
244  }
245  Beliefs bel_ = prepareResults(results_);
246  if(bel_.empty() )
247  return AttrDomain::getUnknownId();
248  else
249  return bel_.at(0).getValue();
250  }
251 
252  template<typename Val>
253  typename RandomForest<Val>::Beliefs RandomForest<Val>::getCategories(const ExampleTest& e) const
254  {
255  std::list< RandomForest<Val>::AttrIdd> results_;
256  for( typename RTrees::const_iterator it=trees_.begin(); it != trees_.end(); it++ )
257  {
258  RandomTree & obj = *(*it); // dereference iterator, dereference pointer
259  results_.push_back(obj.getCategory(e));
260  //std::cout << obj.getCategory(e)->get() << std::endl;
261  }
262  Beliefs bel_ = prepareResults(results_);
263  if(bel_.empty() )
264  return Beliefs();
265  else
266  return bel_;
267  }
268 
269  template<typename Val>
270  void RandomForest<Val>::createForest()
271  {
272  size_t size_ = Classifier<Val>::getAttrDomains().size();
273  // Breiman Forest-RI recommendation
274  N_ = N_ != 0 ? N_ : ceil(sqrt(static_cast<int>(size_)));
275  //std::cout << "K:"<<K_<< std::endl;
276  //std::cout << "N:"<<N_<< std::endl;
277  // create collection of trees with random attributes
278  for(int i=0;i<K_;++i)
279  trees_.push_back(boost::shared_ptr<RandomTree>(new RandomTree( RandomTree::CoverDomains(Classifier<Val>::getAttrDomains(),uniformRandomGenerator(N_,size_-1,false)),Classifier<Val>::getCategoryDomain())));
280 
281  }
282 
283  template<typename Val>
284  typename RandomForest<Val>::Beliefs RandomForest<Val>::prepareResults(const std::list<typename RandomForest<Val>::AttrIdd>& list_) const
285  {
286  std::vector<std::pair<typename RandomForest<Val>::AttrIdd,double>> resultsList_;
287  std::map<typename RandomForest<Val>::AttrIdd,double> count_;
288  Beliefs toRet_;
289  // Create map of occurrence
290  for( typename std::list<typename RandomForest<Val>::AttrIdd>::const_iterator it=list_.begin(); it != list_.end(); it++ )
291  {
292  // Get the feature name
293  typename Val::Value class_ = ((typename RandomForest<Val>::AttrIdd) *it)->get();
294  // And check whether this feature already exists in map
295  auto itClass_ = find_if(count_.begin(), count_.end(), [&class_](const std::pair<typename RandomForest<Val>::AttrIdd,double>& obj) {return obj.first->get()==class_;});
296  // Create new element if not or increase the counter if so
297  if (itClass_ != std::end(count_))
298  ++itClass_->second;
299  else
300  ++count_[*it];
301  }
302  // Normalize map values by list_ size - switch replicates into probability
303  // Convert std::map into std::vector of pairs
304  for( typename std::map<typename RandomForest<Val>::AttrIdd,double>::const_iterator it = count_.begin(); it != count_.end(); ++it )
305  resultsList_.push_back(std::pair<typename RandomForest<Val>::AttrIdd,double>(it->first,it->second/list_.size()));
306  // Sort a vector of pairs based on the probability
307  std::sort(resultsList_.begin(), resultsList_.end(),
308  boost::bind(&std::pair<typename RandomForest<Val>::AttrIdd,double>::second, _1) >
309  boost::bind(&std::pair<typename RandomForest<Val>::AttrIdd,double>::second, _2));
310  // Create Beliefs
311  for( typename std::vector<std::pair<typename RandomForest<Val>::AttrIdd,double>>::const_iterator it = resultsList_.begin(); it != resultsList_.end(); ++it )
312  toRet_.push_back(typename Beliefs::value_type(it->first,it->second));
313  return toRet_;
314  }
315 
316  template<typename Val>
317  typename RandomForest<Val>::ExamplesTrain RandomForest<Val>::exampleBootstrap(const ExamplesTrain& example_)
318  {
319  size_t S_ = example_.size();
320  ExamplesTrain subset_;
321  std::vector<int> sample_ = uniformRandomGenerator(S_, S_-1, true);
322  for( std::vector<int>::iterator it = sample_.begin(); it != sample_.end(); ++it )
323  subset_.push_back(*std::next(example_.begin(),*it));
324 
325  return subset_;
326  }
327 
328  template<typename Val>
329  std::vector<int> RandomForest<Val>::uniformRandomGenerator(std::size_t size, std::size_t range, bool isReplacementON)
330  {
331  std::vector<int> toRet_(size, -1);
332  // \-> by default whole vector is initiate with zeros
333  // and it would be dangerous if we generate numbers from zero
334  RandomInt uniform_generator(0, static_cast<int>(range) );
335  for( std::vector<int>::iterator it = toRet_.begin(); it != toRet_.end(); ++it )
336  {
337  int sample_ = uniform_generator();
338  while( !isReplacementON && std::find(toRet_.begin(), toRet_.end(), sample_) != toRet_.end() )
339  {
340  sample_ = uniform_generator();
341  }
342  *it = sample_;
343  }
344 
345  return toRet_;
346  }
